content.question: The current in an inductor of inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> as a function of time is given by the equation <math alttext="I of t equals, I sub 0, end sub, times the sine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> is a positive constant with appropriate units. Derive an expression for the power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> delivered to the inductor at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>.

choices.label: <math alttext="one half L times I sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine squared of, open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>L</mi><msubsup><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="L times I sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis, times the cosine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>L</mi><msubsup><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega L, times I sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis, times the cosine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mi>L</mi><msubsup><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="L I sub 0, end sub, times omega times the cosine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>L</mi><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>ω</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="omega L, times I sub 0, end sub, squared, times the sine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis, times the cosine of open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mi>L</mi><msubsup><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
